about.description:
parse_type extends the parse module (opposite of string.format()) with the following features:
* build type converters for common use cases (enum/mapping, choice)
* build a type converter with a cardinality constraint (0..1, 0..*, 1..*) from the type converter with cardinality=1.
* compose a type converter from other type converters
* an extended parser that supports the CardinalityField naming schema and creates missing type variants (0..1, 0..*, 1..*) from the primary type converter
dev_url: https://github.com/jenisys/parse_type
about.summary: Simplifies to build parse types based on the parse module

about.description:
parse_type extends the parse module (opposite of string.format()) with the following features:
* build type converters for common use cases (enum/mapping, choice)
* build a type converter with a cardinality constraint (0..1, 0..*, 1..*) from the type converter with cardinality=1.
* compose a type converter from other type converters
* an extended parser that supports the CardinalityField naming schema and creates missing type variants (0..1, 0..*, 1..*) from the primary type converter
dev_url: https://github.com/jenisys/parse_type
about.summary: Simplifies to build parse types based on the parse module

name: parse_type
raw_meta_yaml:
schema_version: 1

context:
  version: 0.6.6

package:
  name: parse_type
  version: ${{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/p/parse_type/parse_type-${{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 513a3784104839770d690e04339a8b4d33439fcd5dd99f2e4580f9fc1097bfb2

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: python
  script: ${{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . --no-deps -vv

requirements:
  host:
    - python ${{ python_min }}.*
    - setuptools
    - pip
    - setuptools_scm
    - wheel
  run:
    - python >=${{ python_min }}
    - parse >=1.18.0
    - six >=1.15

tests:
  - python:
      imports:
        - parse_type
      pip_check: true
      python_version: ${{ python_min }}.*

about:
  license: BSD-3-Clause
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: Simplifies to build parse types based on the parse module
  description: |
    parse_type extends the parse module (opposite of string.format()) with the following features:
    * build type converters for common use cases (enum/mapping, choice)
    * build a type converter with a cardinality constraint (0..1, 0..*, 1..*) from the type converter with cardinality=1.
    * compose a type converter from other type converters
    * an extended parser that supports the CardinalityField naming schema and creates missing type variants (0..1, 0..*, 1..*) from the primary type converter
    dev_url: https://github.com/jenisys/parse_type


  homepage: https://github.com/jenisys/parse_type

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - stuertz
    - thewchan
